sen.j: 和田正信（わだ まさのぶ、? - 元和 (日本)2年（1616年））は安土桃山時代から江戸時代初期にかけての武士。
sen.e: Masanobu WADA (date of birth unknown - 1616) was a samurai (warrior) who lived from the Azuchi-momoyama period to the early Edo period.

sen.j: 父は和田信維、弟に和田庄兵衛。
sen.e: His father was Nobutada WADA, and his younger brother was Shobei WADA.

sen.j: 通称・夫兵衛、官位は壱岐守。
sen.e: His common name was Fuhyoe, and his official rank was Iki no kami (governor of Iki Province.)

sen.j: 『因府録』所収の和田系図には信也と記されている。
sen.e: The family record of the WADA included in "Inpuroku" (local history record of Inpu) says his name was Nobunari.
sen.cmt: 『因府録』の定訳は不明でしたので、"Inpuroku" (local history record of Inpu)としました。また、「信也」の読みが不明でしたので、「のぶなり」としました。
sen.e: The lineage of the Wada family included in "Inpuroku" (local history record of Inpu) represents his name as Nobunari.

sen.j: 文禄元年（1592年）、父・信維の死去に伴い、和田家を継ぐ。
sen.e: Masanobu WADA succeeded to the WADA family in 1592 in accordance with his father Nobutada's death.
Masanobu succeeded to the WADA family headship in 1592 upon the death of his father Nobutada.
sen.cmt: Masanobu WADA→Masanobu家督を継いだという意味で「headship」を加えています。In accordance with→upon
sen.e: Masanobu succeeded to the WADA family headship in 1592 upon the death of his father Nobutada.

sen.j: 池田輝政に仕え、慶長5年（1600年）8月、岐阜城攻めの軍勢に加わり、戦功を為した。
sen.e: He served Terumasa IKEDA, and in August 1600, he joined the troops to attack Gifu-jo Castle and achieved a feat in the battle.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦い後、主君の池田輝政が52万石を領して播磨国姫路城主となると家禄4600石が与えられた。
sen.e: When his lord Terumasa IKEDA received the territory of 520 thousand koku (crop yields) and became the castellan of Himeji Domain, Harima Province after the Battle of Sekigahara, Masanobu was given karoku (hereditary stipend) of 4600 koku.

When his lord Terumasa IKEDA was awarded the territory of 520,000 koku (crop yields of rice per year of the estate) and became the castellan of Himeji-jo Castle located in Harima Province after the Battle of Sekigahara, Masanobu was given karoku (hereditary stipend) of 4,600 koku.
sen.cmt: 「姫路城主」は「姫路城の城主」の意味になるよう修正しました。石高を両者比較しやすいよう、52万石も数字記載としました。石の説明を多少加えました。
sen.e: When his lord Terumasa IKEDA was awarded the territory of 520,000 koku (crop yields of rice per year of the estate) and became the castellan of Himeji-jo Castle located in Harima Province after the Battle of Sekigahara, Masanobu was given karoku (hereditary stipend) of 4,600 koku.

sen.j: 慶長8年（1603年）、幼い池田忠継に従って備前国岡山藩に移ると、家老に取り上げられ政務を執った。
sen.e: In 1603, he moved Okayama Domain, Bizen Province to follow young Tadatsugu IKEDA, and at that time he was promoted to Karo (chief retainer) and administered affairs of the domain.

In 1603, he accompanied a still young Tadatsugu IKEDA to Okayama Domain, Bizen Province as Tadatsugu was assigned to become the lord of Okayama feudal clan; he was promoted to Karo (chief retainer) of the Okayama feudal clan and administered the affairs.
sen.cmt: followed→accompanied時間的な流れを考え、フレーズの順序を変更しました。
sen.e: In 1603, he accompanied a still young Tadatsugu IKEDA to Okayama Domain, Bizen Province as Tadatsugu was assigned to become the lord of Okayama feudal clan; he was promoted to Karo (chief retainer) of the Okayama feudal clan and administered the affairs.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)2年（1616年）、死去、法名は宗光院。
sen.e: He died in 1616, and his homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Sokoin.
sen.cmt: 「宗光院」の読みが不明でしたので、「そうこういん」としました。
sen.e: He died in 1616, and his homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Sokoin.

sen.j: 没年については『因府年表』を参考にしたが、これには異説も存在しており、『鳥取藩史』着座家伝には寛永の初年に没したとある。
sen.e: The year he died is referred to "Inpunenpyo" (Timeline of Inaba Province), however, there is a different opinion and in Chakuzakaden (hereditary records of deputy of chief retainer) included in "Tottori han shi" (the history of Tottori Domain), it is written that he died in the first year of Kanei era.
sen.cmt: 「着座家伝」の定訳は不明でしたが、Chakuzakaden (hereditary records of deputy of chief retainer)としました。
sen.e: His year of death is referred to "Inpunenpyo" (Timeline of Inaba Province); however, there is a different description retarding his year of death that he died in the first year of Kanei era according to the Chakuzakaden (hereditary records of deputy of chief retainer) included in "Tottori han shi" (the history of Tottori Domain).
sen.cmt: 一般的なフレーズ（読み易いもの）に修正しました。
sen.e: His year of death is referred to "Inpunenpyo" (Timeline of Inaba Province); however, there is a different description retarding his year of death that he died in the first year of Kanei era according to the Chakuzakaden (hereditary records of deputy of chief retainer) included in "Tottori han shi" (the history of Tottori Domain).

sen.j: 正信には実子がいなかったため、荒尾成房三男の和田三正を養子にして、家督を継がせた。
sen.e: Since Masanobu didn't have a biological child, he adopted Tadamasa WADA, the third son of Narifusa ARAO, and passed the reigns of the family to Tadamasa.
Since Masanobu did not have any biological child, he adopted Tadamasa WADA, the third son of Narifusa ARAO, and handed over the headship of the family to Tadamasa.
